column4: how does kde handle hidden folders?  gnome does it by a dot prefix
Linux in general uses the convention of hiding files that being with a dot.

then join #ubuntu+1. anyway, either Edgy or KDE 3.5.5 (not sure which one is responsible) has made most folders hidden by default in dialogs and file browsers. in dialogs, you can right click and choose to view all files - in konqueror i'm not sure
i'm not exactly looking to fix tags, since i can do that in amarok. i'm looking to rename files using the tags
apt-cache show easytag <- check a package's description before assuming it doesn't do something ;-)
specifically, "Ability to rename files from the tag (using masks) or by loading a text file"
ah ok then. thanks.  i'll consider my options
lamego's sounds much better. my xargs command would have required a -print0 option to find, and also an -n 1 (or somethign) option to xargs
Exactly what I was looking for.  Thanks a lot.
